title: How to Copy Save Files to Another Wii

steps.headline: Turn on the Wii with the save files that you want to copy.
Insert an SD card in the slot in the front of the console.
Look at the top of the screen and make sure you are in the "Wii" tab.
Find the icon of the game that you want to copy.
This should copy the files to your SD Card.
Now go to the other Wii (where you want the save files at).
Insert the SD card into the slot in the Wii.
Make sure you go to the "SD Card" tab.
Find the icon of the game that you want to copy.
The file should be saved.
steps.description: Go to the Wii menu and play on the copied Wii file.

tyn: One with the save data you want to copy
text: Turn on the Wii with the save files that you want to copy.  Insert an SD card in the slot in the front of the console.  Click on "Options>Data Management>Save Data>Wii"  Look at the top of the screen and make sure you are in the "Wii" tab.  Find the icon of the game that you want to copy.  Click on it and select "Copy"  This should copy the files to your SD Card.  Now go to the other Wii (where you want the save files at).  Insert the SD card into the slot in the Wii.  Go to "Options > Data Management > Wii"  Make sure you go to the "SD Card" tab.  Find the icon of the game that you want to copy.  Click on it and select "Copy".  The file should be saved. Go to the Wii menu and play on the copied Wii file.

Now go to the other Wii (where you want the save files at).
Insert the SD card into the slot in the Wii.
Go to "Options > Data Management > Wii"  Make sure you go to the "SD Card" tab.
Find the icon of the game that you want to copy.
Go to the Wii menu and play on the copied Wii file.
